title: a bug while building a docker container with spack

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
<!-- Explain, in a clear and concise way, the command you ran and the result you were trying to achieve.
Example: "I ran `spack find` to list all the installed packages and ..." -->

Spack cannot delete a building directory while removing garbage (i.e. **spack gc -y**). This bug only pops up while spack is building an image. Probably, there is a bug in the spack image.  

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ cat ./spack.yaml
spack:
  specs:
  - eigen@3.3.7
  - openblas@0.3.9
  - libxsmm@1.15
  - cmake@3.16.0

  container:
    format: docker

    base:
      image: "ubuntu:18.04"
      spack: develop

    strip: true

    os_packages:
      - cxxtest
      - python3
      - make

$ spack containerize > Dockerfile
$ docker build --tag mycontainer:latest .
...
```

### Error Message

<!-- If Spack reported an error, provide the error message. If it did not report an error but the output appears incorrect, provide the incorrect output. If there was no error message and no output but the result is incorrect, describe how it does not match what you expect. -->
```console
==> Restricting the garbage collection to the "/opt/spack-environment" environment
==> Error: Could not remove prefix /opt/software/linux-ubuntu18.04-skylake/gcc-7.5.0/pkgconf-1.6.3-uhvjvnwuzaug3giyrmwky6ylaqkvmrud for pkgconf@1.6.3%gcc@7.5.0 arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-skylake/uhvjvnw : [Errno 39] Directory not empty: 'man5'
```
